ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Level of engagement with this class was not very high online as much of the content seemed to be self-taught/reading the textbook on your own.
Advanced one-variable calculus
I learned more clearly how to calculate integrals and series, as well as the applications of these concepts in the mathematical and practical world.
Ability to understand and evaluate integrals, series and other Calc 2 content

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: More helpful live sections or videos so students don't feel like they have to learn it all on their own.
Having a clearer syllabus where the expected topic for each class is noted on
The course is nicely divided into three distinct parts, which makes it easy to orient yourself around
The course places a lot of emphasis on examinations. This is good, but some sort of participation grade should exist to motivate more class participation.

The explore before every session was great and I found it very helpful to understand what I needed to know going into every lesson. I think that the way that the course has been structured is great and facilitates student learning well

Strength: small class size, interesting material
Weakness: online, class is boring if other students don't participate

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Recorded lectures that go over concepts could be added.

It worked well most of the time. Review sessions were recorded which was extremely helpful as they took place late in EST and with the time zone difference it was difficult to attent. Recordings of regular classes would have been helpful too.
Virtual format was very confortable
Using jamboard as a class board worked very well. The instruction was not hindered over zoom overall.
The online aspect of this course was handled very well. The zooms were very good and I think that all of the online content plus explores and concept checks helped a lot

jamboard was great! Still miss writing on an actual white board though. Also, scanning written math homework /tests and submitting it on gradescope was a really nice way to keep math on paper as much as possible.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Not unless you need it as a prerequisite to another class.
The course is great if you need to learn advanced calculus and advance later into the field that requires extensive math
Yes. It is a good foundational course for upper level mathematics.
Yes, if you need to take it

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Explorations (Quizzes)
Virtual seminar
None
None other
